title: Branching & Collaboration
description: Branch management, merging, rebasing, and team workflows

cards.task: Create and switch to a new feature branch
cards.description: Creates a new branch off the current HEAD and moves your working tree to it in one step.
cards.whenToUse: Starting scoped work that should be isolated from main until review.
scenarios: New feature: Begin work on a feature without touching main
Bugfix branch: Isolate hotfix changes for a quick pull request
Spike: Explore an idea safely without polluting stable branches

cards.description: Shows all branches, including remote-tracking ones, so you know what exists and where.
cards.whenToUse: Before switching, cleaning up stale branches, or checking if a branch already exists on origin.
scenarios: Avoid duplicates: Confirm a teammate already pushed a branch before creating your own
Cleanup: Identify stale local branches to delete
Tracking: Verify a branch is published to origin before opening a PR

cards.task: Update your feature branch with the latest main
cards.answer: git fetch origin && git rebase origin/main
cards.description: Fetches new commits from origin and rebases your current branch on top of the updated main branch.
cards.whenToUse: Before opening or updating a PR to minimize merge conflicts and keep history linear.
scenarios: PR refresh: Rebase before requesting review so diff only shows your changes
Conflict prevention: Reduce chances of merge conflicts by staying current
CI stability: Rebase to include the latest main fixes before rerunning pipelines

cards.task: Merge a completed branch into the current branch
cards.description: Merges another branch into the current one while preserving a merge commit for history clarity.
cards.whenToUse: When you want a merge commit to mark integration of a feature or PR.
scenarios: Release integration: Merge a feature branch into main after approval
Audit trail: Keep a merge commit to show when a feature landed
Conflict resolution: Perform the merge locally to resolve conflicts before pushing

cards.task: Stash uncommitted work with a label
cards.description: Saves tracked changes to a named stash and restores a clean working tree without committing.
cards.whenToUse: When you need to switch branches or pull updates without committing WIP changes.
scenarios: Urgent hotfix: Stash ongoing work to apply a production patch
Review prep: Clean workspace before rebasing or merging
Context switch: Pause a feature to help on another task without losing progress

cards.task: Reapply the most recent stash and drop it
cards.description: Restores the latest stashed changes to your working tree and removes that stash entry.
cards.whenToUse: After returning to the original branch or task and ready to continue the stashed work.
scenarios: Resume work: Continue the feature after handling a hotfix
Conflict check: Ensure stashed changes still apply cleanly after upstream updates
Cleanup: Avoid accumulating stale stashes by popping instead of keeping them

cards.task: Cherry-pick a specific commit onto the current branch
cards.description: Applies the changes from a single commit to your current branch, creating a new commit with the same diff.
cards.whenToUse: When you need one commit from another branch without merging the whole branch.
scenarios: Hotfix backport: Bring a fix from main to a release branch
Selective adoption: Grab a useful change from a teammate's branch
PR cleanup: Move a commit from one branch to another without redoing work

cards.task: Squash or reorder recent commits interactively
cards.description: Opens an interactive rebase for the last n commits so you can squash, reorder, or edit messages.
cards.whenToUse: Before pushing a branch or requesting review to produce a clean, logical commit history.
scenarios: PR hygiene: Squash fixup commits into a single coherent change
Message cleanup: Rewrite commit messages for clarity before review
History organization: Reorder commits so changes build logically

cards.task: Create an annotated tag for a release
cards.description: Creates a named, annotated tag that records the release message and metadata at the current commit.
cards.whenToUse: When marking a release candidate or production release in the repository history.
scenarios: Versioning: Tagging v1.2.0 before publishing a GitHub release
Hotfix marker: Tagging a patch release off a maintenance branch
Deployment traceability: Tag commits that correspond to deployed artifacts

cards.task: Push a specific tag to origin
cards.description: Sends an annotated tag to the remote repository so teammates and CI/CD can use it.
cards.whenToUse: After creating a release tag locally and you want it available on GitHub.
scenarios: Release distribution: Make the tag visible for GitHub Releases or package pipelines
Coordination: Share a tag so others can check out the exact release commit
Automation triggers: Push a tag that kicks off release workflows in CI
